evidence: As the Re addition increases from 0 to 0.5, the yield strength of the alloys is improved from 1058 MPa to 1147 MPa, while the room-temperature ductility increases from 2.6% to 7.0%.

As the Re addition increases from 0 to 1, the yield strength,  compressive strength, and fracture strain of Re x NbMoTaW alloys exhibit similar trend as the microhardness increasing firstly and then decreasing. Re0.5 alloy reached the highest mechanical properties, with the yield strength, maximum strength, and fracture strain of 1147 ± 10 MPa, 1465 ± 18 MPa, and 7.01 ± 0.30%, respectively.
The Re 0.5 NbMoTaW alloy reaches the maximum hardness, yield strength, compressive strength and fracture strain of 567 ± 9 HV, 1147 ± 10 MPa, 1465 ± 18 MPa, and 7.01 ± 0.30%, respectively.
